post.description:
Ingest files into the system.

This endpoint supports multipart/form-data requests, enabling you to ingest files and their associated metadatas into R2R.

A valid user authentication token is required to access this endpoint, as regular users can only ingest files for their own access. More expansive group permissioning is under development.

x-codeSamples.source:
from r2r import R2RClient

client = R2RClient("http://localhost:8000")
# when using auth, do client.login(...)

result = client.ingest_files(
    files=["pg_essay_1.html", "got.txt"],
    metadatas=[{"metadata_1":"some random metadata"}, {"metadata_2": "some other random metadata"}],
    document_ids=None,
    versions=None
)

post.description:
Update existing files in the system.

This endpoint supports multipart/form-data requests, enabling you to update files and their associated metadatas into R2R.




A valid user authentication token is required to access this endpoint, as regular users can only update their own files. More expansive group permissioning is under development.

x-codeSamples.source:
from r2r import R2RClient

client = R2RClient("http://localhost:8000")
# when using auth, do client.login(...)

result = client.update_files(
    files=["pg_essay_1_v2.txt"],
    document_ids=["b4ac4dd6-5f27-596e-a55b-7cf242ca30aa"]
)

post.description:
Perform a search query on the vector database and knowledge graph.

This endpoint allows for complex filtering of search results using PostgreSQL-based queries.
Filters can be applied to various fields such as document_id, and internal metadata values.


Allowed operators include `eq`, `neq`, `gt`, `gte`, `lt`, `lte`, `like`, `ilike`, `in`, and `nin`.

x-codeSamples.source:
from r2r import R2RClient

client = R2RClient("http://localhost:8000")
# when using auth, do client.login(...)

result = client.search(
    query="What is the capital of France?",
    vector_search_settings={
        "use_vector_search": True,
        "filters": {"document_id": {"eq": "3e157b3a-8469-51db-90d9-52e7d896b49b"}},
        "search_limit": 20,
        "use_hybrid_search": True
    }
)

post.description:
Execute a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) query.

This endpoint combines search results with language model generation.
It supports the same filtering capabilities as the search endpoint,
allowing for precise control over the retrieved context.

The generation process can be customized using the rag_generation_config parameter.

x-codeSamples.source:
from r2r import R2RClient

client = R2RClient("http://localhost:8000")
# when using auth, do client.login(...)

result = client.rag(
    query="What is the capital of France?",
    vector_search_settings={
        "use_vector_search": True,
        "filters": {"document_id": {"eq": "3e157b3a-8469-51db-90d9-52e7d896b49b"}},
        "search_limit": 20,
        "use_hybrid_search": True
    },
    rag_generation_config={
        "stream": False,
        "temperature": 0.7,
        "max_tokens": 150
    }
)

post.description:
Implement an agent-based interaction for complex query processing.

This endpoint supports multi-turn conversations and can handle complex queries
by breaking them down into sub-tasks. It uses the same filtering capabilities
as the search and RAG endpoints for retrieving relevant information.

The agent's behavior can be customized using the rag_generation_config and
task_prompt_override parameters.
Register a new user with the given email and password.

Verify a user's email address.

This endpoint is used to confirm a user's email address using the verification code
sent to their email after registration.

Authenticate a user and provide access tokens.

This endpoint authenticates a user using their email (username) and password,
and returns access and refresh tokens upon successful authentication.

Log out the current user.

This endpoint invalidates the user's current access token, effectively logging them out.

get.description:
Get the current user's profile information.

This endpoint returns the profile information of the currently authenticated user.

put.description:
Update the current user's profile information.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to update their profile information.

post.description:
Refresh the access token using a refresh token.

This endpoint allows users to obtain a new access token using their refresh token.

Change the authenticated user's password.

This endpoint allows users to change their password by providing their current password
and a new password.

Request a password reset for a user.

This endpoint initiates the password reset process by sending a reset link
to the specified email address.

delete.description:
Delete a user account.

This endpoint allows users to delete their own account or, for superusers,
to delete any user account.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: ID of the user to delete
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: ID of the user to delete

post.description:
Perform graph enrichment, e.g. GraphRAG, over the ingested documents.

Returns:
    Dict[str, Any]: Results of the graph enrichment process.

delete_vector_data.title: Delete Vector Data
delete_vector_data.description: Whether to delete the user's vector data

files.title: Files
files.description: The list of paths of input files to ingest into the system.

document_ids.title: Document Ids
document_ids.description: An optional list of document ids for each file. If not provided, the system will generate a unique document id via the `generate_user_document_id` method.

metadatas.title: Metadatas
metadatas.description: An optional list of JSON metadata to affix to each file

chunking_settings.title: Chunking Settings
chunking_settings.description: An optional dictionary to override the default chunking configuration for the ingestion process. If not provided, the system will use the default server-side chunking configuration.

files.title: Files
files.description: The list of paths of input files to update in the system.

document_ids.title: Document Ids
document_ids.description: An optional list of document ids for each file. If not provided, the system will generate a unique document id via the `generate_user_document_id` method.

metadatas.title: Metadatas
metadatas.description: An optional list of JSON metadata to affix to each file

chunking_settings.title: Chunking Settings
chunking_settings.description: An optional dictionary to override the default chunking configuration for the ingestion process. If not provided, the system will use the default server-side chunking configuration.

full_text_weight.title: Full Text Weight
full_text_weight.description: Weight to apply to full text search

semantic_weight.title: Semantic Weight
semantic_weight.description: Weight to apply to semantic search

full_text_limit.title: Full Text Limit
full_text_limit.description: Maximum number of results to return from full text search

IndexMeasure.title: IndexMeasure
IndexMeasure.description:
An enum representing the types of distance measures available for indexing.

Attributes:
    cosine_distance (str): The cosine distance measure for indexing.
    l2_distance (str): The Euclidean (L2) distance measure for indexing.
    max_inner_product (str): The maximum inner product measure for indexing.

failed_documents.title: Failed Documents
failed_documents.description: List of documents that failed to process

skipped_documents.title: Skipped Documents
skipped_documents.description: List of document IDs that were skipped during processing

max_knowledge_triples.title: Max Knowledge Triples
max_knowledge_triples.description: The maximum number of knowledge triples to extract from each chunk.

generation_config.description: Configuration for text generation during graph enrichment.

KGGlobalSearchResult.title: KGGlobalSearchResult
KGGlobalSearchResult.description: Result of a global knowledge graph search operation.

KGLocalSearchResult.title: KGLocalSearchResult
KGLocalSearchResult.description: Result of a local knowledge graph search operation.

KGSearchResult.title: KGSearchResult
KGSearchResult.description: Result of a knowledge graph search operation.

max_llm_queries_for_global_search.title: Max Llm Queries For Global Search

completion.title: Completion
completion.description: The generated completion from the RAG process

search_results.description: The search results used for the RAG process

message.content: Paris is the capital of France.

metadata.text: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.
metadata.title: france_info.pdf

vector_search_results.text: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

kg_search_results.title: Kg Search Results
kg_search_results.description: Knowledge graph search results, if applicable

metadata.associatedQuery: What is the capital of France?

metadata.associatedQuery: What is the capital of France?

use_hybrid_search.title: Use Hybrid Search
use_hybrid_search.description: Whether to perform a hybrid search (combining vector and keyword search)

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: Filters to apply to the vector search

search_limit.title: Search Limit
search_limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

index_measure.description: The distance measure to use for indexing

include_values.title: Include Values
include_values.description: Whether to include search score values in the search results

include_metadatas.title: Include Metadatas
include_metadatas.description: Whether to include element metadata in the search results

probes.title: Probes
probes.description: Number of ivfflat index lists to query. Higher increases accuracy but decreases speed.

ef_search.title: Ef Search
ef_search.description: Size of the dynamic candidate list for HNSW index search. Higher increases accuracy but decreases speed.
